messages.message:
Getting some otel-releated build failures cc @Cody Boggs

https://jenkins.instabase.com/blue/rest/organizations/jenkins/pipelines/instabase/branches/PR-71657/runs/3/nodes/31/log/?start=0

```clean build test-changes TRACE_SHELL=true GITHUB_TOKEN=**** PR_NUMBER=instabase/PR-71657 CLEAN=true
[2025-06-26T15:17:55.477Z] /bin/sh: 1: otel-cli: not found
[2025-06-26T15:17:55.477Z] make: *** [Makefile:43: docker-pr-merge-check] Error 127
script returned exit code 2[2025-06-26T15:17:58.477Z] find: '*c4be4e30aabe51a0e40f6f76bf258a5c*.json': No such file or directory
[2025-06-26T15:17:58.477Z] find: 'bep-*c4be4e30aabe51a0e40f6f76bf258a5c*.json': No such file or directory```

Yea, have to run with `rebuild` not `restart from stage`
It's a mostly useless feature in Jenkins sadly, but when there's only a single stateful stage in a pipeline it can work ok-ish - but adding any additional stages that need to do anything beyond making a remote API call or similar will break it. :disappointed:
Ooh there's a flag to disable it in the pipeline DSL. Never could find it in the GUI, didn't think about the pipeline script opts

What does this have to do with:
```/bin/sh: 1: otel-cli: not found```
?
Because it's added in a previous stage, which is skipped when using that feature to skip said stage
Well, I did use rebuild (either that or re-pushed)
According to the log, you used the restart from stage option: https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/instabase/job/PR-71657/3/console
